ovdesc.p: Arrangement architecture (AA) has property class as its basic building block. AA files are divided into 4 main files each sharing the same file structure. For example, CUSTOMER class has the following classification:

Even though they share the same file structure, they are independent templates and need seperate template artefacts to function. To simplify the task of creating artefacts across all four levels, this utility may be used.

AA.DEV.HELPER is a standard utility that creates all of the artefacts that are required to run an application in T24. The key to the record is the AA.PROPERTY.CLASS id that you are working on, and once verified will perform a number of actions if relevant fields are flagged. This file uses the same infrastructure as that of EB.DEV.HELPER.

desc.p: When the user creates a new property class and artefacts for them, and requires all these artefacts to be chucked into PvCS, the user may decide to flag this field which updates all items updated to DIM.NEW.ITEMS record. The id of DIM.NEW.ITEMS application would be taken from DIM.NEW.NAME. If a record already exists for this id, then the current details would be appended onto the existing record. The user would still have to verify the DIM.NEW.ITEMS record to create the actual items. This is only a utility to create such record.
When STANDARD.SELECTION needs to be created/updated for the template, this field may be flagged to YES.
When files need to be created/updated for the template, this field may be flagged to YES.
When file control needs to be created/updated for the template, this field may be flagged to YES.
When DAS programs need to be created for the template, this field may be flagged to YES
When PGM.FILE needs to be created/updated for the template, this field may be flagged to YES.
When Insert needs to be created/updated for the template, this field may be flagged to YES.
The id of the DIM.NEW.NAME would be assumed to be that of the current ID(Property class id). But when a specific name needs to be stated, it can be defined here.

The id to this record is a property class id. When a particular attribute is flagged, it creates artefacts across all four levels - PRD, PRF, CAT and ARR. To create artefacts for standalone templates(not dealing with AA.PROPERTY.CLASS), the user can make use of another utility - EB.DEV.HELPER.
Should be a valid entry in AA.PROPERTY.CLASS
